content.description:
Image 1

Jan Steen, Dutch painter, The Burgher of Delft and his Daughter, 1655

In the Public Domain

The portrait most likely depicts the corn merchant Adolf Croeser and his daughter, Catharina. The burgher hears the plea of a begging widow and her son.

Image 2

Jan Steen, Dutch painter, The Dissolute Household, 1663-1664

Apsley House, The Wellington Museum, London,UK/Bridgeman Images
content.question: The choice of subject matter in the two paintings is best explained by which of the following historical developments during the artist’s life?

choices.label: The Netherlands' achievement of independence from the Habsburg Empire after the Thirty Years’ War
The establishment of religious toleration in the Netherlands after the Reformation
The poor harvests and other effects of the Little Ice Age in the seventeenth century
The growth of a wealthy trading elite in the Netherlands

content.answer: The growth of a wealthy trading elite in the Netherlands

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience of a source.
